Service: The service at "La Isla's" is excellent.
They don't rush you to order, they give you just the right amount of time to choose what to order.
In some places they take so long to give and take the check, well not at La Isla's a Cuban food delight.
The spinach chicken dish is my favorite, it's so full of flavor and never disappoints.

La Isla - Uptown has a very different feel than their original location on First & Washington in Hoboken.

Unlike the homey mom and pop feel of the original location, Las Isla uptown has a modern, clean, upscale vibe - nothing wrong with that just something to note if you'd been to the original location and are expecting the same experience.

I liked the bar setup and the tables all around.
We started with the red sangria, it was strong AF.
We also had the yuca fries (highly recommend), the veggie and chicken empanadas, and ceviche.
I love Cuban food and I've been to Cuban restaurants all over including The Cuban (in Hoboken) and authentic Cuban restaurants in Miami and this place can hold its own.
The staff are genuinely friendly, the food is great and the sangria pitchers are not all juice like most other places.
I had the lechon asado which was not nearly as flavorful as it should be (mojo sauce lacked garlic and lime flavors I expect).

Medium portions.
We got a 1/2 white sangria pitcher (which was pretty strong) and each of us got a sandwich off the menu.
I got the Media Noche which was essentially the most tender Cuban sandwich I've ever had.
For sides we got the tostones (deliciously garlicky) and the maduros (super sweet).
Pitcher of red sangria and skirt steak and your set.
Was seated immediately in a nice window side table.

Looking forward to when I move to Hoboken in a couple months and can revisit this great place!
Came here for my birthday dinner and it was a great choice.

The absolute best Spanish food in Hudson County!
Always love dining at La Isla - either uptown or downtown.

La Isla Downtown, of course, is a beloved fixture of Hoboken, with quirky decor, fast service, friendly staff and amazing food.

I'll happily go back to the one on Washington Street, but I'm never setting foot here again, and if you care about a great Cuban experience, I suggest you do the same.

The food here is awesome with the classics like a Cuban sandwich and Ropa Vieja, but some others like the pork sandwiches and shrimp dishes are less expected and just as good.
Unlike other Cuban places, the plantains are very flavorful and even the rice and beans are great.
It's the perfect place for a filling lunch or a nice dinner.

My husband ordered the Omar's stuffed French toast (since it was featured in food network) and I opted for the omelette which you get to choose 3 fillings (I ordered chorizo, manchego cheese, and maduros).
The omelette was served with a small serving of their homefries (which were good) and Cuban toast (Yum).
I was expecting more guava cheese and not so much strawberry.
We also ordered 2 brunch cocktails which WERE STRONG!

We celebrated a family member's birthday here.
I called ahead and asked if they had cakes like in birthday cakes.
I showed up with a birthday cake and was told there would be a "cutting fee" of $1.50 per slice.
So as a family we decided to enjoy the cake at a members home, since it was clearly not something the restaurant wanted.
The dinner and wait staff were excellent.
So when the check arrives there is an additional, though nominal fee for this tiny amount of the sauce.
Needless to say if took the fun out of the Birthday part of the dinner.

Cannot say enough about how wonderful our experience at La Isla was!
She gave us a sample of the wine to make sure we liked it before purchasing the entire bottle and was able to get us an order of Tres Leches even after the kitchen had closed.
Lastly, I have never had a more delicious Tres Leches cake than I did here last night.
It was the perfect blend of spongey and milky.
Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a trendy ambiance with delicious food and drinks!
Then for dessert we got the tres leches cake - which is probably the best tres leches cake I had.
The staff was on point with their customer service, especially Joe and Sandra; the food was amazing!

So when I heard of Hoboken La Isla opening another location uptown, particularly in Maxwell, not surprisingly, I wasn't too enthused.
After all, Cuban food in Hoboken is fantastic between The Cuban, Zafra, and La Isla.

Came relatively soon after their official opening and were able to get a table for two with ease across from the counter.The new establishment was noticeably louder and seemed designed to do a lot more than their location on Washington St. Yet,that's where the problems occurred.
It was pretty crowed but we managed to get seated quickly near the back kitchen area next to the bar.
It was pretty crowed but we managed to get seated quickly near the back kitchen area next to the bar.

I have to say the food was excellent but it took an incredibly long time for us to get our food, drinks and even when we tried to order dessert it took so long that we had to again wave down someone to cancel the dessert order because we had to get going.

I have to say the food was excellent but it took an incredibly long time for us to get our food, drinks and even when we tried to order dessert it took so long that we had to again wave down someone to cancel the dessert order because we had to get going.

As all of this was going on I could see our waiter behind the bar/ in the kitchen talking and laughing with his staff, obviously too busy to help us with anything so the busy bartender and hostess kept coming over to get our drinks, desert and give us the check at the end of the meal.
The entire time we felt like we were pulling teeth trying to get anyone's attention all the while, watching our waiter in the kitchen/ bar talking and doing nothing.
I had high hopes for the new location of La Isla.
And they have a bar - with great, hospitable and fun bartenders.
The layout is spacious, there is a nice bar area and ample seating for groups of a variety of sizes.
With a real Cuban flavor...
Felt like summer vacation.
No crazy ingredients.
Home made, not from a Panara soup bladder.

Perfect texture and flavor.
Nice sauce.

I've been to the La Isla downtown and found out about the new uptown location randomly.
Come for the great drinks, incredible food, and go see John at the bar - awesome experience!

First off, my friend and I are huge fans of La Isla and have been going there for many many years, in fact, it's my favorite restaurant on the planet to date.

The new place looks amazing and the service was excellent, however it was extremely loud and we had to shout at our friends in order to be heard in a conversation, it was like being at an elementary school cafeteria during lunchtime.

I've eaten at the original La Isla down on Washington Street a few times and always enjoyed the food there, but I was especially glad when I noticed they were opening a second location closer to where I live.
On Friday (07/03), my boyfriend and I decided to check this place out and see if it was just as good as the La Isla we've come to know and love.
Food was not bad but I felt that I experienced a soft opening and ended up paying the bill.I ate there on July 4th and was offered a very basic menu (3 starters, 3 main courses).
Food was not bad but I felt that I experienced a soft opening and ended up paying the bill.I ate there on July 4th and was offered a very basic menu (3 starters, 3 main courses).
I really want La Isla to be a success but they need to get their act together otherwise people will just walk to The Cuban or Havana.
I will try again in a months time and hopefully things will be different.
Our waitress was lovely but service was SLOW - it took over 30 minutes for a cold appetizer to arrive.
I ordered a cocktail and it tasted great but there wasn't even a trace of alcohol in the drink and the serving size was tiny.
La Isla is one of my favorite Cuban restaurants in Hoboken and I am SO happy that they opened a location in uptown.
